meanings.definition: An act of passing something along to another person or group.
meanings.sent1: During the game of telephone, each player relays a message to the next person.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used a relay to send the attendance sheet to the office.
meanings.sent3: The relay of snacks from the kitchen to the party was like a tasty game of tag.
meanings.sent4: The relay of information between the two departments was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent5: The relay of good news spread quickly through the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A device used to control the flow of electricity in a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The technician installed a relay to regulate the power supply.
meanings.sent2: The relay clicked softly as it redirected the electrical current.
meanings.sent3: The relay in the circuit felt like a traffic cop directing the electricity.
meanings.sent4: The relay acted as a gatekeeper, allowing electricity to flow only when needed.
meanings.sent5: The relay hummed quietly as it managed the electricity flow.

meanings.definition: A series of races in which team members take turns running.
meanings.sent1: In the relay race, each runner passes the baton to the next teammate.
meanings.sent2: The school organized a relay to raise funds for charity.
meanings.sent3: The relay competition was like a fun game of tag with a baton.
meanings.sent4: The relay event brought out the spirit of teamwork among the participants.
meanings.sent5: The relay race was filled with excitement as each runner sprinted towards victory.
